content: to rh needle place bor marker this is the center back of the hat each earflap is 27 sts front of hat is 29 33 sts back of hat is 21 25 sts 104 112 sts check your stitch count work k1 p1 ribbing for 1 inch the earflap ribbing and new cast on sts should line up so ribbing is continuous knit one row plain and at same time decrease as follows note this plain round counts as round 1 of chart a small/medium decrease 7 sts k6 decrease k13 x 6 decrease k6 97 sts decrease = decrease = large/xl decrease 3 sts k35 decrease x 2 knit to last 2 sts decrease 109 sts use ssk if next st on lh needle is a knit st use k2tog if next st on lh needle is a purl st page 3 charts start on page 7 use charts a & c for the small/medium sizes charts b & c for l/xl start chart a for small/medium chart b for l/xl start with round 2 on chart all chart rounds are read from right to left note i switched to a size 8 needle to work the stranded rounds and back to a sz 7 for plain rnds this change accounts for gauge differences between stranded and plain row however this adjustment is knitter dependent note which set of needle sizes you are using remember the last repeat is different than the first repeats in order to minimize the jog it may be helpful to add a marker for the last repeat that is different than the bor marker stitch counts change throughout because of the jog adjustment complete through round 28 97 107 sts remain next round continue with navy and work one plain round decreasing as follows small/medium k7 k2tog x 1 k6 k2tog x 2 then k10 k2tog x 5 k6 k2tog x 1 k4 88 sts large/xl k5 k2tog x 1 k6 k2tog k10 k2tog x 2 k6 k2tog x 2 k4 96 sts work chart c both sizes before knitting chart c the hat should measure about 5 ½ inches to the cast on edge if your hat is getting too long you can adjust here by omitting chart c or just working row 1 & 2 or 1 & 3 crown shaping continue in navy with size 7 needles knit 2 plain rounds and then start crown shaping for your size switch to dpns when the stitch count warrants the finished crown will add about 3 inches to the overall height of the hat cut yarn leaving a generous tail pull yarn tail through remaining sts and tighten to close do not trim tail it will be used to secure the top tassel continue next page finish hat small/medium crown shaping k9 k2tog x 8 k 2 rnds k8 k2tog x 8 k 2 rnds k7 k2tog x 8 k 1 round k6 k2tog x 8 k 1 rnds k5 k2tog x 8
